intro: Tropilis bidupensis, commonly known as the Bidupens wildflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of South America. It features slender, upright stems that can grow up to 60 centimeters in height, adorned with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to thrive in well-drained, rocky soils. Tropilis bidupensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with suitable climatic conditions.
